article_title: Rockerville Man Killed In Faulk County Crash
article_text:
Faulkton, SD

A Rockerville, South Dakota man is dead and a pair of Faulkton residents are hurt after a two-vehicle crash in Faulk County Saturday afternoon.

Fifty-three-year-old Randall Carleton was traveling westbound on US Highway 212 near Faulkton when his car crossed the center lane and crashed head-on into a pickup truck. Carleton died from his injuries.

The driver of the pickup, 75-year-old Raymond Bloom, received serious but non life-threatening injuries. Bonnie Bloom, 72, was a passenger in the truck; she received minor injuries.

Highway Patrol continues to investigate the accident.
